data: This is a lexical resource based on WordNet, which assigns sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to each word sense (synsets).

This contains approximately 5,000 textual snippets collected from financial news and press releases concerning Finnish companies trading on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled (annotated) as positive, negative, or neutral.

This is a dataset for understanding sentiment in financial text, which coordinates Artificial Intelligence and Semantic Web technologies to better identify, interpret, and process opinions in this context.

This includes entity-sentiment annotation, enabling the handling of headlines involving multiple entities with potentially conflicting sentiments. This human-annotated dataset of over 10,700 news headlines provides information about changes in sentiment depending on specific entities in financial news.

This is a dataset of tokenized and annotated Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts. This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

This is an annotated dataset of relations in financial documents, containing approximately 29,000 examples and 22 relation types across eight entity pairs (e.g., Person-Title, Organization-Money) extracted from SEC 10-X filings. Useful for identifying relations between entities in financial reports.

This dataset, compiled from various news sources and evaluated by human experts, helps researchers investigate how news headlines affect price fluctuations, volatility comparison, and other financial events.
Designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial domain, this dataset helps identify and classify financial companies in textual data.

This provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset with real-world financial article headlines across 15 languages. Annotated with high-level and low-level topics, it facilitates multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

This is a collection of question-answer pairs with deep analysis of financial reports. Written by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning over financial data and provides training data for answering complex financial questions.
